multiple-choice.question: What is the main idea behind Noam Chomsky's theory of universal grammar?

options.label: D

options.label: D

title: Max and the Tag-Along Moon - Children's books read aloud

multiple-choice.question: What did Granpa say to Max about the moon?

options.label: A
options.text: "The moon will shine only when you're with me."

options.label: B
options.text: "The moon will always shine for you... on and on!"

options.label: C
options.text: "The moon will disappear when you go home."

options.label: D
options.text: "The moon is only visible in the summer."

multiple-choice.question: What did Max do as the car pulled away from Granpa's house?

options.label: A
options.text: He fell asleep.

options.label: B
options.text: He kept his eyes on Granpa until he disappeared from sight.

options.label: C
options.text: He looked at the stars.

options.label: D
options.text: He played with his toys.

multiple-choice.question: What did the moon seem to do as Max traveled home?

options.label: A
options.text: It disappeared from sight.

options.label: B
options.text: It stayed in one place.

options.label: C
options.text: It tagged along with Max.

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: What happened to the night sky as Max approached his home?

options.label: A
options.text: The stars and moon shone brighter.

options.label: B
options.text: The clouds cleared away.

options.label: C
options.text: Dark clouds tumbled across the night sky.

options.label: D
options.text: The nightingales sang louder.

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: What can DNA tests really tell us about our ancestry? - Prosanta Chakrabarty

multiple-choice.question: What percentage of the human genome is shared among all humans?
Why do two sisters with the same parents have different DNA results, such as one being 10% French and the other 0%?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they have different ancestors.

options.label: B
options.text: Because of recombination, which occurs uniquely in each sex cell.

options.label: C
options.text: Because DNA tests are not accurate.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they have different parents.

multiple-choice.question: What do commercial DNA tests utilize to determine an individual's ancestry?

options.label: A
options.text: More than 1% of the 1% of the genome that contains distinct information.

options.label: B
options.text: Less than 1% of the 1% of the genome that contains distinct information.

options.label: C
options.text: 100% of the genome.

options.label: D
options.text: 50% of the genome.

multiple-choice.question: Why may DNA tests not reveal heritage from certain groups of people?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they are not accurate.

options.label: B
options.text: Because the database does not include genomes from those groups.

options.label: C
options.text: Because the tests only look for genetic markers from European descent.

options.label: D
options.text: Because the tests are not sensitive enough.

multiple-choice.question: What does a result of 2% Neanderthal mean in a DNA test?

options.label: A
options.text: That the individual is 2% less human.

options.label: B
options.text: That the individual has 2% of the Neanderthal genome.

options.label: C
options.text: That the individual has Neanderthal ancestors from interbreeding that occurred around 40,000 years ago.

options.label: D
options.text: That the individual is 2% more European.

title: Vowel-rr | Learn to read

multiple-choice.question: What happens to the vowel sound when the letter "R" is added to it?

options.label: A
options.text: The vowel sound remains the same.

options.label: B
options.text: The vowel sound becomes longer.

options.label: C
options.text: The vowel sound changes to a new sound.

options.label: D
options.text: The vowel sound becomes shorter.

options.label: A
options.text: The vowel sound becomes longer.

options.label: B
options.text: The vowel sound changes to a new sound.

options.label: C
options.text: The vowel sound remains the same.

options.label: D
options.text: The vowel sound goes back to being a short sound.

options.text: Car

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: Sorry

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Carry

options.label: C
options.text: Hurry

options.label: D
options.text: Barry

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: When is a pandemic over?

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary condition for the World Health Organization (WHO) to declare a pandemic over?

options.label: A
options.text: The infection is completely eradicated worldwide.

options.label: B
options.text: The death toll drops to zero.

options.label: C
options.text: The infection is mostly contained and rates of transmission drop significantly throughout the world.

options.label: D
options.text: A vaccine is widely available.

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following strategies to address a pandemic involves allowing people to be exposed as quickly as possible?

options.label: A
options.text: Delay and Vaccinate

options.label: B
options.text: Coordinate and Crush

options.label: C
options.text: Race through it

options.label: D
options.text: Quarantine and Isolate

multiple-choice.question: What is the estimated percentage of the population that needs to receive a vaccine to achieve herd immunity?
According to the transcript, what is the primary advantage of the "Coordinate and Crush" strategy?

options.label: A
options.text: It is the quickest way to end a pandemic.

options.label: B
options.text: It is the most cost-effective way to address a pandemic.

options.label: C
options.text: It can end a pandemic in just a few months with low loss of life.

options.label: D
options.text: It is the most reliable way to eradicate a virus.

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary reason why vaccination is considered the best strategy to address a pandemic?

options.label: A
options.text: It is the quickest way to end a pandemic.

options.label: B
options.text: It is the most cost-effective way to address a pandemic.

options.label: C
options.text: It is the slow, steady, and proven option in the race.

options.label: D
options.text: It is the most reliable way to eradicate a virus.

title: Art with Mati and Dada â€“ Berthe Morisot

multiple-choice.question: What is the name given to the group of artists that Berthe Morisot is a part of?

options.label: A
options.text: Expressionists

options.label: B
options.text: Impressionists

options.label: C
options.text: Realists

options.label: D
options.text: Abstract Artists

multiple-choice.question: What is the main focus of Impressionist painting, according to Berthe Morisot?

options.label: A
options.text: Capturing precise details and realism

options.label: B
options.text: Creating abstract and expressive art

options.label: C
options.text: Capturing fast, fleeting moments and the play of sunlight and shadow

options.label: D
options.text: Painting only landscapes and outdoor scenes

multiple-choice.question: How does Berthe Morisot describe the way the eye sees and focuses on different parts of a scene?

options.label: A
options.text: The eye sees everything in sharp focus and detail

options.label: B
options.text: The eye sees only the center of the scene in focus, with the edges blurry

options.label: C
options.text: The eye sees the edges of the scene in focus, with the center blurry

options.label: D
options.text: The eye sees different parts of the scene in focus as it moves and dances around

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about the way Berthe Morisot paints, as described in the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: She uses only primary colors and bold brushstrokes

options.label: B
options.text: She paints only from photographs and not from life

options.label: C
options.text: She captures the impression of a scene, rather than precise details

options.label: D
options.text: She only paints portraits and not landscapes

multiple-choice.question: What does Berthe Morisot say is the key to capturing the impression of a scene in painting?

options.label: A
options.text: Using a wide range of colors and bold brushstrokes

options.label: B
options.text: Painting only in the morning or evening light

options.label: C
options.text: Looking slightly away from the subject and capturing the shape and color

options.label: D
options.text: Using a small brush and precise details
